name: NewYorker
text: Millennia later, the plague of Athens reminds us that the legacy of the world’s first democracy contains within it a cautionary tale: the failure of democratic society to cope with a lethal epidemic. https://t.co/e2hlAEj2xK

name: NewYorker
text: “The world around us was not the one we had worked hard to achieve but the quiet, degraded world that our not-country said we deserved”: Hilton Als reflects on growing up in Brooklyn in the 1960s and 70s.  https://t.co/EfnIfqbvHB

name: NewYorker
text: “I was soaking in the bath for the third time when the monkey slid the glass door open with a clatter and came inside. ‘Excuse me,’ he said in a low voice.” Read Haruki Murakami’s latest story.  https://t.co/De8UTFb6w0

name: NewYorker
text: It’s always 4 p.m. It’s never not 4 p.m., and it will always be 4 p.m. https://t.co/tlrKVHSB9p

name: NewYorker
text: "The Great," starring Elle Fanning as Catherine the Great, is a period show full of vituperative one-liners and thistle-sharp insults. https://t.co/TSsru1Q1oA

name: NewYorker
text:
The author and labor activist Jane McAlevey’s latest book argues that systematic grassroots organizing is the key to repairing today’s ravaged democracy.
https://t.co/8SKOypuk1x

name: NewYorker
text: By following provisions of the Mineral Leasing Act of 1920, a North Dakota company may come to control a large swath of Utah’s federal land. “The law itself is the crime—a gift to the oil and gas businesses,” @billmckibben writes. https://t.co/unaL6kdeBJ

name: NewYorker
text: Who is Fethullah Gülen? Revisit Dexter Filkins on the exiled Turkish cleric living in the Poconos. https://t.co/kbTuOwo6bQ

name: NewYorker
text: “I think there’s a huge conversation about the responsibility within streetwear to acknowledge the contributions from brown and black people,” one podcaster said. https://t.co/FLZ4BAzvd1

name: NewYorker
text: "Da 5 Bloods” is a film about a group of black Vietnam veterans that asks, Why fight and die for a country that will choke you anyway? https://t.co/c9KIIqH56g

name: NewYorker
text: Bryan Washington writes about the intimacy of gay bars before the pandemic. “It’s worth wondering what the function of these spaces is, and whether they’ll survive, and what their survival will mean as the nature of physical space continues to change.” https://t.co/MJdCMGu8BQ
